words.def: (anatomy) the point of connection between two bones or elements of a skeleton (especially if it allows motion)
the shape or manner in which things come together and a connection is made
a particle that is electrically charged (positive or negative)
a luminance unit equal to 1 candle per square meter measured perpendicular to the rays from the source
negation of a word or group of words
a silvery malleable metallic element that resists corrosion
a United States unit of weight equivalent to 2000 pounds
A working-class punk rock  subgenre of the 1970s, sometimes associated with racism.
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
